idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; Esri ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770

descript.abstract: United States Interstate Highways is a polyline theme representing rural and urban interstate highways. Attribute information includes the length, route number and class of the interstate.
descript.purpose: United States Interstate Highways provides a comprehensive database of interstate highways from the nation's principal arterial highway system and the National Highway System. The data is generalized to improve draw performance and be used effectively at a national level.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:250,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

esriterm.Name: intrstat
esriterm.featdesc: U.S. National Transportation Atlas Interstate Highway

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent a comprehensive network database of interstate highways within United States from the principal arterial highway system and National Highway System.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: A composite field for the road feature comprised of the primary sign route that identifies the class, sign route number that can include a directional indicator, and a qualifier. The first character identifies the class, the following characters up to but not including a blank identify the sign route number that can include a directional indicator, a blank, and the last character identifies the qualifier.

edom.edomv: Class, represented by the first character.
edom.edomvd: (blank) - not signed, I - Interstate, U - U.S. route, S - State route, O - Off-Interstate business marker, C - County route, T - Township, M - Municipal, P - Parkway or Forest route marker, N- None of the above.

edom.edomv: Sign route number (can include a directional indicator), represented by all the following characters up to but not including a blank.
edom.edomvd: Any combination of: A-Z, 0-9, N, S, E, W.
This separates the sign route number from the qualifier.

edom.edomv: Qualifier, represented by the last character when preceded by a blank.
edom.edomvd: (blank) - No qualifier, not signed, or not applicable; A - Alternate route; B - Business route; P - Bypass; S - Spur; L - Loop; F - Proposed (future); D - Temporary (detour); T - Truck route; N - None of the above.

edom.edomv: Class, represented by the first character.
edom.edomvd: (blank) - not signed, I - Interstate, U - U.S. route, S - State route, O - Off-Interstate business marker, C - County route, T - Township, M - Municipal, P - Parkway or Forest route marker, N- None of the above.

attr.attrdef: The primary sign route that identifies the class of the road feature.

edom.edomv: Sign route number (can include a directional indicator), represented by all the following characters up to but not including a blank.
edom.edomvd: Any combination of: A-Z, 0-9, N, S, E, W.

attr.attrdef: The primary sign route that identifies the sign route number, that can include a directional indicator, of the road feature.

edom.edomv: Qualifier, represented by the last character when preceded by a blank.
edom.edomvd: (blank) - No qualifier, not signed, or not applicable; A - Alternate route; B - Business route; P - Bypass; S - Spur; L - Loop; F - Proposed (future); D - Temporary (detour); T - Truck route; N - None of the above.

attr.attrdef: The primary sign route that identifies the qualifier, if any, of the road feature.
The length of the road feature in miles.
The length of the road feature in kilometers.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.title: National Highway Planning Network 4.0 (line)
citeinfo.othercit: From the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2002 CD-ROM.

procstep.procdesc: The general processing steps for the creation of the National Highway Planning Network: - [1993] Conflation of attributes for rural highways from [National Highway Planning Network V1.1, Bruce Peterson, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, 1992] to [USGS Digital Line Graph (DLG-3, 1978) Series] road alignments using R-MATCH software developed by the Geographic Information Systems Group, University of Tennessee. - [1993] Digitizing and conversion of state supplied digital and map data. Line work geodetically controlled to match [USGS Digital Line Graph (DLG-3, 1978) Series] line work. - [1994] Integration of conflated version of [National Highway Planning Network V1.1, Bruce Peterson, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, 1992] and assimilated State Departments of Transportation data into a comprehensive topologically integrated network database. States edgematched and National Highway System attributes verified. - [1997] Integration of supplemental State Departments of Transportation data into the National Highway Planning Network Version 2. National Highway System attributes verified. - [1998] Integration of intermodal connectors links into the National Highway Planning Network Version 2. States edgematched and National Highway System attributes verified. - [2001] Update of National Highway System and Intermodal connector links into the National Highway Planning Network Version 4.0. States edgematched and National Highway System attributes verified.

The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied U.S. National Transportation Atlas Highways and symbolized interstates, four-lane roads and the rest uniquely. Selected and kept all interstates, major thoroughfares and any other road segments needed to represent the major drive patterns depicted in a typical highway road atlas. Several features had no route name and were given values from its neighboring features or by referencing the National Geographic Road Atlas. Corrected hundreds of gaps in the road network. Generalized to a tolerance of 0.003 decimal degrees. Added attributes CLASS, NUMBER, and SUFFIX from Esri Data & Maps 2002 U.S. National Transportation Atlas Interstate Highways based on the ROUTE_NUM attribute. Unsplit features based on combining all attributes. Added and calculated attributes DIST_MILES and DIST_KM. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

citeinfo.title: National Geographic Road Atlas, 2012

pubinfo.publish: GeoSystems Global Corporation in association with National Geographic Maps and Melcher Media, Inc.

srcinfo.srccitea: Esri ArcGIS Resource Centers ArcGIS Online services - USA Prime Imagery

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Added Minnesota Drive in Anchorage, AK. Put value "S" in attributes ROUTE_NUM and CLASS, and calculated the values for attributes DIST_MILES and DIST_KM.
The following steps were performed by Esri: Corrected a few known errors. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
procstep.srcused: Esri ArcGIS Resource Centers ArcGIS Online services - USA Prime Imagery

horizpa.horizpar: The original positional accuracy had a maximal positional error of ±80 meters, and then it was generalized to a tolerance of 0.003 decimal degrees. The positional accuracy is unknown.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
